page.title: 01General Landscape
page.content: This area is located on the coast and much of it comprises a series of raised beaches upon which the main features i.e. 3 villages (Lower Largo, Upper Largo and Lundin Links) and two golf courses.To the N.East the land rises steeply to a peak of 290m at Largo Law which is a hill created by an extinct volcano.The coastline is partly rocky but also offers fine sandy beaches and dunes.Further inland the recreation and urban land cover give way to mixed farmland.Lower Largo is famed for it's Robinson Crusoe connections.The climate of the area is attractive with an average precipitation of 800mm (driest months,February,April,June) and average summer temperatures of 15 degrees centigrade.
